result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution TBD following Restitution Hearing.
AMENDED 05-19-2017:  No restitution requested.

Provide a DNA sample.
Cooperate with any assessment or treatment required by Probation & Parole.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling

records.addlTxt: DOC - Notice of Case Status Change Slip - Discharge
Waiver of Appearance and Motion to Modify
Letter from DOc requesting 30 days conditional jail time with huber.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DA advising victim in this matter is no longer requesting restitution.
Letter requesting Restitution Hearing be removed.  No restitution requested by victim.

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel confirms receipt of PSI, no corrections.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements.  No witnesses by either side.  State recommends 3 yrs. probation; restitution $1330, which amount is different than reported earlier; other conditions as suggested by DOC.  Defense counsel objects to the restitution amount as not consistent to statement of police.  Court won't order restitution today, counsel to set a hearing before leave today.  Defense counsel agrees with State's recommendation.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation, no jail; conditions:  cooperate with any assessment or treatment required by P&P; pay restitution TBD; waive costs; provide a DNA sample today at the jail; advised of appeal rights.
Restitution hearing on May 30, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant waives right to PH, files WOPH form with the Court.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her PH done K&V and binds her over.  Counsel agrees to use the criminal complaint for the Information and the State to file later.  Court advises defendant of count 1 burglary as a repeater/max. penalties.  Atty Schembera requests to confer with his client.  Off record.  On record.  Defendant wishes to proceed.  Court advises defendant of her constitutional rights.  To count 1 burglary as repeater, defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty on count 1, dismiss count 2 and order PSI.  Referred to scheduling clerk.  Defendant confirms her address is the same.

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schembera first appearance with defendant.  TLW for PH.  Any conditions of bond previously set are continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights. Defendant WTL for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
